name: soprano
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a woman or girl with a voice that can sing the highest notes: Sopranos Ann Monoyios and Miriam Dubrow sang with beaming, radiant sweetness.
US (UK treble) a boy with a voice that sings the highest notes: The range of his voice changed a lot over his career; he started as a soprano and finished an alto.

having a voice that uses the highest notes: She sang regularly as a soprano soloist in many choral works. The soprano voice of a 13-year-old boy singing rang through the building.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
at the top of a range of soundhighShe has a very high voice.high-pitchedHe talks to his dog in the most ridiculous high-pitched voice.shrillHe called the dog back with a shrill whistle.reedyHe had a thin, reedy voice.
